Detailed Description

Routines for post processing (detection/angle estimation) of data output by the Hardware Accelerator.

Definition in file post_processing.h.

Function Documentation

void angleEstimationAzimElev ( uint16_t *  azimFFTAbsPtr,
uint16_t *  azimFFTPtr,
uint16_t *  elevFFTPtr,
MmwDemo_DataPathObj *  obj 
)

Function finds for each detected object the peak in the azimut FFT and the based on complex values of azimuth and elevation FFT corresponding to peak position, calculates the x,y,z coordinates of the object.

Parameters
[in]azimFFTAbsPtrPointer to array with magnitude values of azimuth FFTs of detected objects. The length of each FFT is numAngleBins. The size of input array is numAngleBins * numObjOut
[in]azimFFTPtrPointer to array with complex values of azimuth FFTs of detected objects. The length of each FFT is numAngleBins. The size of input array is numAngleBins * numObjOut
[in]elevFFTPtrPointer to array with complex values of elevation FFTs of detected objects. The length of each FFT is numAngleBins. The size of input array is numAngleBins * numObjOut
[in]objPointer to Data path object.

uint32_t calcNoiseFloor ( uint32_t *  radarCubedMemPtr,
uint32_t  numDopplerBins,
uint32_t  numRangeBins,
uint32_t  numVirtualAnt 
)

Calculate noise energy (diagnostic only) This routine calculates the noise energy Assumes a predominantly static scene- and averages the values in the high velocity bins to estimate noise energy.

Parameters
[in]radarCubedMemPtrPointer to 2nd D FFT buffer with complex symbols. The size of buffer is numRangeBins * numDopplerBins * (numVirtualAntAzim + numVirtualAntElev)
[in]numDopplerBinsNumber of Doppler bins
[in]numRangeBinsNumber of range bins
[in]numVirtualAntNumber of virtual antennas

Definition at line 670 of file post_processing.c.

Referenced by MmwDemo_dataPathTask().

void MmwDemo_azimHeapMapDopplerCompensation ( cmplx16ImRe_t *  azimuthHeapMap,
uint16_t  dopplerIdx,
uint32_t  numTxAnt,
uint32_t  numRxAnt,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntAzim,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntElev,
uint32_t  numDopplerBins,
uint32_t  numRangeBins 
)

Function is executed after the HWA CFAR algorithm or Peak grouping if enabled. It compensates the Siganl on Azimuth and Elevation attennas due to signal transmit time shift from different TX antennas.

Parameters
[in]azimuthHeapMapPointer to Azimuth Heap map that filled with antenna symbols. The compensation will be applied in place.
[in]dopplerIdxDoppler Index used for doppler compensation
[in]numTxAntNumber of Tx antennas
[in]numRxAntNumber of Rx antennas
[in]numVirtualAntAzimNumber of virtual Rx antennas
[in]numVirtualAntElevNumber of virtual Rx antennas
[in]numDopplerBinsNumber of Doppler bins
[in]numRangeBinsNumber of Range bins
Returns
None

void MmwDemo_dopplerCompensation ( uint32_t  numDetectedObjects,
uint32_t *  srcPtrAzim,
uint32_t *  srcPtrElev,
MmwDemo_detectedObj *  objOut,
uint32_t *  dstPtrAzim,
uint32_t *  dstPtrElev,
uint32_t  numTxAnt,
uint32_t  numRxAnt,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntAzim,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntElev,
uint32_t  numDopplerBins 
)

Function is executed after the HWA CFAR algorithm or Peak grouping if enabled. It compensates the Siganl on Azimuth and Elevation attennas due to signal transmit time shift from different TX antennas.

Parameters
[in]numDetectedObjectsNumber of detected objects by HWA CFAR algorithm
[in]srcPtrAzimInput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for azimuth calculation.
[in]srcPtrElevInput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for elevation calculation.
[in]objOutOutput pointer to the structure with with selected objects. The function fills range and doppler index of the object.
[out]dstPtrAzimOutput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for azimuth calculation.
[out]dstPtrElevOutput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for elevation calculation.
[in]numTxAntNumber of Tx antennas
[in]numRxAntNumber of Rx antennas
[in]numVirtualAntAzimNumber of virtual Rx antennas
[in]numVirtualAntElevNumber of virtual Rx antennas
[in]numDopplerBinsNumber of Doppler bins
Returns
None

Here is the call graph for this function:

uint32_t MmwDemo_peakGrouping ( uint32_t  numDetectedObjects,
uint16_t *  detBuffptr,
cfarDetOutput_t *  cfarObjptr,
uint32_t *  fftBuffptr,
MmwDemo_detectedObj *  objOut,
uint32_t *  peakGrpAzimOut,
uint32_t *  peakGrpElevOut,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntAzim,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntElev,
uint32_t  numDopplerBins,
uint32_t  minRangeIdx,
uint32_t  maxRangeIdx,
uint32_t  groupInDopplerDirection,
uint32_t  groupInRangeDirection 
)

Function is executed after the HWA CFAR algorithm. It reduces the number of detected objects performed by CFAR algorithm. It selects only those objects with peaks greater than its neighbors.

Parameters
[in]numDetectedObjectsNumber of detected objects by HWA CFAR algorithm
[in]detBuffptrPointer to range-doppler matrix which was used by CFAR alogorithm to generate detected objects, size number of range bins times number of doppler bins.
[in]cfarObjptrPointer to the output structure generated by CFAR algorithm, contains list of detected objects.
[in]fftBuffptrPointer to 2nd D FFT buffer with complex symbols. The size of buffer is numRangeBins * numDopplerBins * (numVirtualAntAzim + numVirtualAntElev).
[out]objOutOutput pointer to the structure with with selected objects. The function fills range and doppler index of the object.
[out]peakGrpAzimOutOutput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for azimuth calculation.
[out]peakGrpElevOutOutput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for elevation calculation.
[in]numVirtualAntAzimNumber of virtual Rx antennas
[in]numVirtualAntElevNumber of virtual Rx antennas
[in]numDopplerBinsNumber of Doppler bins
[in]minRangeIdxMinimum range index to be exported
[in]maxRangeIdxMaximum range index to be exported
[in]groupInDopplerDirectionpeak grouping in Doppler direction 0-disabled, 1-enabled
[in]groupInRangeDirectionpeak grouping in Range direction 0-disabled, 1-enabled
Returns
numObjOut Number of selected objects

Function is executed after the HWA CFAR algorithm. It reduces the number of detected objects performed by CFAR algorithm. It selects only those objects with peaks greater than its neighbors.

uint32_t postDetectionProcessing ( uint32_t  numDetectedObjects,
uint16_t *  detBuffptr,
cfarDetOutput_t *  cfarObjptr,
uint32_t *  fftBuffptr,
MmwDemo_detectedObj *  objOut,
uint32_t *  dstPtrAzim,
uint32_t *  dstPtrElev,
uint32_t  numTxAnt,
uint32_t  numRxAnt,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntAzim,
uint32_t  numVirtualAntElev,
uint32_t  numDopplerBins,
uint32_t  numRangeBins,
uint32_t  minRangeIdx,
uint32_t  maxRangeIdx,
uint32_t  groupInDopplerDirection,
uint32_t  groupInRangeDirection 
)

Function is executed after the HWA CFAR algorithm. It reduces the number of detected objects performed by CFAR algorithm. It selects only those objects with peaks greater than its neighbors.

Parameters
[in]numDetectedObjectsNumber of detected objects by HWA CFAR algorithm
[in]detBuffptrPointer to range-doppler matrix which was used by CFAR alogorithm to generate detected objects, size number of range bins times number of doppler bins.
[in]cfarObjptrPointer to the output structure generated by CFAR algorithm, contains list of detected objects.
[in]fftBuffptrPointer to 2nd D FFT buffer with complex symbols. The size of buffer is numRangeBins * numDopplerBins * (numVirtualAntAzim + numVirtualAntElev).
[out]objOutOutput pointer to the structure with with selected objects. The function fills range and doppler index of the object.
[out]dstPtrAzimOutput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for azimuth calculation.
[out]dstPtrElevOutput pointer (local memory of HWA) filled with antenna symbols of selected objects for elevation calculation.
[in]numTxAntNumber of Tx antennas
[in]numRxAntNumber of Rx antennas
[in]numVirtualAntAzimNumber of virtual azimuth Rx antennas
[in]numVirtualAntElevNumber of virtual elevation Rx antennas
[in]numDopplerBinsNumber of Doppler bins
[in]numRangeBinsNUmber of Range bins
[in]minRangeIdxminimum range index to be exported
[in]maxRangeIdxmaximum range index to be exported
[in]groupInDopplerDirectionpeak grouping in Doppler direction 0-disabled, 1-enabled
[in]groupInRangeDirectionpeak grouping in Range direction 0-disabled, 1-enabled
Returns
numObjOut Number of selected objects
